subject: Re: [junit] How to create Progress Bar for JUnit?
msgSnippet: Hi i6941, I didn t realize you were looking for a GUI runner from your initial post. ScalaTest has one, and it can run JUnit tests. You just pass -j
messageBody:
Hi i6941,

I didn't realize you were looking for a GUI runner from your initial post.
ScalaTest has one, and it can run JUnit tests. You just pass -j
<JUnit-test-class-name> to Runner, as described here:

http://www.artima.com/docs-scalatest-1.5-SNAPSHOT-5-May-2011/#org.scalatest.tools.Runner$

You'd need to put scala-library.jar on the class path, but wouldn't need to
use Scala to just run JUnit tests.

Bill
